item.title: CISF sees 40% decline in deaths among its personnel - The Hindu
item.description:
CISF Achieves 40% Decrease in Personnel Suicide Rates

Published: January 02, 2025 11:18 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) has reported a significant 40% decline in deaths by suicide among its personnel, attributed to proactive measures implemented within the force. The national suicide rate has simultaneously risen in India.

  • The CISF suicide rate decreased from 12.4 per lakh in 2022 to 9.87 per lakh in 2024.
  • Proactive measures included personalized engagements and an online grievance portal for timely support.
  • Approximately 4,200 personnel received mental health support through 24x7 counselling services.
  • A comprehensive mental health study conducted with AIIMS, New Delhi, informed actionable steps.
  • A new HR policy aims to improve work-life balance, focusing on personal needs and mental health.
“It is for the first time in the last five years that CISF suicide rate has fallen below the national rate,” sources mentioned.

These initiatives showcase an effective response to the increasing mental health challenges faced by security personnel in India.

item.title: Karnataka: Woman kills husband, smashes his face with stone, chops body - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Woman Arrested for Murdering Husband, Disposing Body in Karnataka

Date: Jan 02, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

A woman in Karnataka's Belagavi was arrested for allegedly murdering her husband and chopping his body, police said on Thursday.

  • The woman allegedly strangled her 40-year-old husband, identified as Srimantha Itnali, and then smashed his face with a stone.
  • She cut his body into two pieces to dispose of it away from her house.
  • The incident took place on December 8, and the body was found on December 10 in Umarani village in Chikkodi taluk of Belagavi.
  • The police initially did not suspect the woman, but later brought her in for questioning, and she confessed to the crime.
  • The husband was reportedly a drunkard who abused his wife for money and wanted her to sell a piece of land to buy him a new motorbike.
"She first strangled him and when he was unconscious, used a boulder lying nearby to smash his face. She then disposed of the boulder in a well."

The woman has been taken into custody.

item.title: Government report reveals stark infrastructure gap in Indian schools - The Hindu
item.description:
Government Report Highlights Infrastructure Gaps in Indian Schools

Date: January 02, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The latest report by the Unified District Information System for Education (UDISE+) reveals alarming gaps in infrastructure across Indian schools, with many lacking essential facilities like electricity, functional toilets, and access to computers.

  • Out of 14.71 lakh schools in India, 1.52 lakh have no functional electricity.
  • Only 67,000 schools operate without functional toilets, mainly affecting government schools.
  • Only 33.2% of government schools have disabled-friendly toilets, with fewer being functional.
  • 50% of all schools lack access to computers for educational purposes.
  • Only 10.5% of schools have implemented solar panel facilities.
  • Only 17.5% of schools have co-curricular activity rooms or arts and crafts facilities.
  • In government secondary schools, 50.2% have science laboratory facilities.
"The condition is much worse when it comes to providing disabled-friendly facilities, with only 33.2% of schools having disabled-friendly toilets."

This report underscores a significant need for improvement in the infrastructure of schools in India, especially for the government-run institutions.

Amit Shah: Article 370 Fueled Terrorism in Kashmir

Published on: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

  • Article 370 fostered separatism among Kashmiri youth, leading to terrorism.

“Why did terrorism not spread in other Muslim areas of the country? ... It is unfortunate that 40,000 people lost their lives,” Mr. Shah said.

The Home Minister further emphasized the importance of re-evaluating Kashmir's history and offered perspectives that could reshape national narratives.

item.title: Bhopal gas tragedy: Toxic waste removed from Union carbide factory after 40 years - BBC.com
item.description:
Bhopal gas tragedy: Toxic waste removed from Union carbide factory after 40 years

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: BBC News

Authorities in India have successfully removed hundreds of tonnes of toxic waste from the site of the 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy, where thousands died from a gas leak. The removal follows a court order aimed at addressing the long-standing environmental and health hazards posed by the waste.

  • 337 tonnes of toxic waste transported to an incinerator 230 km away.
  • The waste removal comes 40 years after the gas leak incident that killed thousands.
  • Activists express concern over the health risks of incinerating the waste at the new location.
  • Groundwater near the factory remains contaminated, affecting residential areas.
  • Previous attempts to dispose of the waste faced significant opposition and were abandoned.
  • The Bhopal gas tragedy is considered one of the world’s largest industrial disasters.
“The 1.1 million tonnes of toxic soil and waste still continues to contaminate the groundwater of hundreds and thousands of people [in Bhopal].” – Rachna Dhingra, International Campaign for Justice in Bhopal

In conclusion, while the recent removal of toxic waste marks a significant step, concerns remain about the long-term impact on health and the environment, and there is a continued need for comprehensive solutions to the ongoing contamination in Bhopal.

Top officials from the Ministry of Home Affairs and the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs met to identify potential sites for a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

  • Two sites shortlisted: Ekta Sthal and Vijay Ghat.
  • Ekta Sthal is near Jawaharlal Nehru’s samadhi, while Vijay Ghat is near Mahatma Gandhi’s memorial.

item.title: DSP Gursher Sandhu dismissed for facilitating Lawrence Bishnoi interview - The Indian Express
item.description:
DSP Gursher Sandhu Dismissed for Facilitating Gangster Interview

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

The Punjab Government has dismissed Deputy Superintendent of Police Gursher Singh Sandhu for facilitating the recording of an interview with notorious gangster Lawrence Bishnoi while he was in police custody.

  • Sandhu facilitated interviews with Bishnoi while he was held by the CIA in Kharar.
  • The interviews were aired on a private news channel in March 2023.
  • The dismissal orders were issued by the Secretary of the Department of Home Affairs.
  • Sandhu was under suspension since October 25, 2024, and evaded receiving a chargesheet.
  • The Punjab Public Service Commission approved Sandhu's dismissal under Article 311(2)(b) of the Indian Constitution.
“After careful consideration of the facts and circumstances, the state government is satisfied that Gursher Singh Sandhu has severely dented the image of the Punjab Police through his actions,” stated the dismissal order.

The decision to dismiss Sandhu is seen as a move to restore the credibility of the Punjab Police following significant misconduct by officers involved in the case.
